    ABOUT ME

    Originally from Brooklyn, New York, I served in the U.S. Army and was assigned to the Combat Aviation Brigade of the 3rd Infantry Division from 2004 to 2011. The Military gave me the structure and discipline to continue as a Police Officer for the City of Savannah, Georgia from 2012 to 2017. Teamwork, camaradre and dedication are a part of my life, and I bring the skills I've mastered thus far into everything I do.


    This photo brings back memories! Shot in 2007, just before a second deployment to Baghdad, Iraq. My time as a soldier gave me valuable, lifelong skills and discipline.

    Photo op for the "Why I Wear the Badge" campaign with the Savannah-Chatham Metro Police Department. Being a police officer gave me an opportunity to serve my community.


    A short time after relocating to Nashville and dabbling with code, I became fascinated with software development as a concept and as a carreer choice. I have found my niche, as developing and creating gives me the opportunity to work with others, to learn and think in a whole new way, and to bring new and fun ideas to life.


    PROJECTS

    Here are a few projects I've worked on.


    Train-U

    Lorem ipsum, or lipsum as it is sometimes known, is dummy text used in laying out print, graphic or web designs. The passage is attributed to an unknown typesetter in the 15th century who is thought to have scrambled parts of Cicero's De Finibus Bonorum et Malorum for use in a type specimen book.

    Marche'
